1.q_string: If the charge of 1 C is placed at a distance of 1 m from another charge of the same magnitude in a vacuum, it experiences an electrical force repulsion of magnitude ____________.

q_option: Integral multiples of a basic unit of charge
There exists a minimum permissible charge on a particle
1.q_string: The quantisation of charge indicates that :
An ______________ is a surface with a constant value of potential at all points on the surface.
Calculate the potential at the centre of the hexagon if a regular hexagon of side \(10 \mathrm{~cm}\) has a charge 5 \(\mu \mathrm{C}\) at each of its vertices.

At room temperature \(\left(27.0^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\right)\) the resistance of a heating element is \(100 \Omega\). What is the temperature of the element if the resistance is found to be \(117 \Omega\), given that the temperature coefficient of the material of the resistor is \(1.70 \times 10^{-4}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}^{-1}\).

Estimate the average drift speed of conduction electrons in a copper wire of cross-sectional area \(1.0 \times 10^{-7} \mathrm{~m}^2\) carrying a current of \(1.5 \mathrm{~A}\). Assume that each copper atom contributes roughly one conduction electron. The density of copper is \(9.0 \times 10^3 \mathrm{~kg} / \mathrm{m}^3\), and its atomic mass is \(63.5 \mathrm{u}\).
Magnetic field at any point inside the straight solenoid is given as-

A long straight wire in the horizontal plane carries a current of \(50 \mathrm{~A}\) in the north to south direction. Give the magnitude of \(\mathrm{B}\) at a point \(2.5 \mathrm{~m}\) east of the wire.

A short bar magnet placed with its axis at \(30^{\circ}\) with a uniform external magnetic field of \(0.25 \mathrm{~T}\) experiences a torque of magnitude equal to \(4.5 \times\) \(10^{-2} \mathrm{~J}\). What is the magnitude of the magnetic moment of the magnet?

When a bar magnet of dipole moment \(\mathrm{m}\) is placed in a uniform magnetic field B, then:

(a) The force on it is zero.

(b) The torque on it is \(\mathrm{m} \times \mathrm{B}\).

Which of the following statement is correct?

Two concentric circular coils, one of small radius \(r_1\) and the other of large radius \(r_2\), such that \(r_1 \ll r_2\), are placed co-axially with centres coinciding. Obtain the mutual inductance of the arrangement.
AC generator is based on which principal?
A resistor of \(200 \Omega\) and a capacitor of \(15.0 \mu \mathrm{F}\) are connected in series to a \(220 \mathrm{~V}, 50 \mathrm{~Hz}\) ac source. Calculate the current in the circuit.

The energy losses in transformer is due to:

(i) Flux Leakage

(ii) Resistance of the windings

(iii) Eddy currents

(iv) Hysteresis

Calculate the electric field produced by the radiation coming from a \(100 \mathrm{~W}\) bulb at a distance of \(3 \mathrm{~m}\). Assume that the efficiency of the bulb is \(2.5 \%\) and it is a point source.
The frequency range of Radio waves is from ________to about _________.
Deviation of which of the following lights is the maximum when it passes through a prism?

Light from a point source in air falls on a spherical glass surface ( \(n=1.5\) and radius of curvature \(=20 \mathrm{~cm}\) ). The distance of the light source from the glass surface is \(100 \mathrm{~cm}\). At what position the image is formed?
The critical angle of incidence \(i_c\) for a ray incident from a denser to rarer medium, is that angle for which the angle of refraction is _____________.
An object is placed at \(10 \mathrm{~cm}\), in front of a concave mirror of radius of curvature \(15 \mathrm{~cm}\). Find  magnification of the image.
Assume that light of wavelength \(6000\) \(\mathring{A}\) is coming from a star. What is the limit of resolution of a telescope whose objective has a diameter of 100 inch?
What is the intensity of transmitted light when a polaroid sheet is rotated between two crossed polaroids?

Monochromatic light of frequency \(6.0 \times 10^{14} \mathrm{~Hz}\) is produced by a laser. The power emitted is \(2.0 \times 10^{-3} \mathrm{~W}\). How many photons per second, on an average, are emitted by the source?
\(4.6 \times 10^{22}\) atoms of an element weight \(13.8 \mathrm{~g}\). What is the atomic mass of the element?
The work function of caesium is \(2.14 \mathrm{eV}\). Find the wavelength of the incident light if the photocurrent is brought to zero by a stopping potential of \(0.60 \mathrm{~V}\).

find the quantum number of the orbit of the satellite when a \(10 \mathrm{~kg}\) satellite circles earth once every \(2 \mathrm{~h}\) in an orbit having a radius of \(8000 \mathrm{~km}\). Assuming that Bohr's angular momentum postulate applies to satellites just as it does to an electron in the hydrogen atom.

q_option: Electrons are majority carriers and trivalent atoms are the dopants.
Electrons are minority carriers and pentavalent atoms are the dopants.
Holes are minority carriers and pentavalent atoms are the dopants.
Holes are majority cariers and trivalent atoms are the dopants.
1.q_string: Which of the following statement is true regarding n-type Semiconductor?

It is found experimentally that \(13.6 \mathrm{eV}\) energy is required to separate a hydrogen atom into a proton and an electron. Compute the orbital radius and the velocity of the electron in a hydrogen atom.
The half-life of \({ }_{38}^{90} \mathrm{Sr}\) is 28 years. What is the disintegration rate of \(15 \mathrm{mg}\) of this isotope?
Which of the following is Insulator?
